result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J. Sheehan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs/surcharges to be paid in installments of $100.00 per month as previously ordered with next payment due 03-01-2016.
AMENDED 03-04-2016:  County Appointed Attorney Fees Ordered $238.00.
10 days in the Pepin County and stayed for a period of 6 months on condition of completing 80 hours of community service and on condition of paying County Appointed Attorney Fees TBD.
Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 80 hours of community service.   Consequences of termination from the program:  Lift stay of jail.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric J. Sheehan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Community Service Completion Report.
Obligations of community service completed as of 8/17/16 as verified by C/S Coordinator.
16R 001161 - Balance owing on payment plan paid in full.

Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Atty.  Ordered that $238.00 be allowed to said atty as compensation of his professional service and disbursements, said sums to be paid to said Atty. by Pepin County and Pepin County shall be reimbursed by defendant as previously ordered.
Petition for Payment of County Appointed Attorney Fees

Referred to Buffalo-Pepin Counties Criminal Justice Coordinating Council for completing 80 hours of community service.  Identify the project by 03-16-2016. Complete all hours by 08-16-2016 with minimum of 8 hours per month.   Consequences of termination from the program:  Revoke stay of jail, go to jail 10 days.

Defendant Eric J. Sheehan in court with attorney Melissa R. Peterson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will plead to count 1, imposed 10 days jail & stay it in exchange of completing 80 hrs. C/S w/in 6 months.    Court advises defendant of elements of count 1/max. penalties.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Plea Colloquy. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty, dismiss 15FO115; sentenced to 10 days in the PCJ & stay it for 6 months on condition of completing 80 hrs. C/S; condition of stay also to pay county appointed attorney fees TBD & cont. paying at current rate; impose costs; provide DNA sample; advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Eric J. Sheehan in court.  Attorney Melissa R. Peterson appeared by phone means for Defendant Eric J. Sheehan.Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel received offer from State, need new date.  Counsel to call scheduling clerk.

Ordered that Attorney Melissa Peterson is appointed to represent the defendant as defense counsel.  Further Ordered That the defendant shall reimburse the County by monthly installments of $100.00 per month commencing 02-01-2016, subsequent payments due the same day of each and every month thereafter.  Failure to make scheduled payments without a showing by the defendant of good cause shall be contempt of court punishable under Ch. 785, Wis. Stats. and the Court shall do any of the following:  See Order

Defendant Eric J. Sheehan in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant requests county appointed attorney, didn't qualify for SPD.  Defendant employed.  Off record for defendant to speak with Atty Peterson.  On record, defendant appears with Atty Melissa Peterson who accepts case.  NGP entered, also has citation from same incident scheduled for 2/2 at 1:00 p.m.  15FO115 time changed to 2/2 at 2:30 p.m. to track with this case.  Status conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
